metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8818 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The cpu_physical_memory_write_rom_internal function in exec.c in QEMU (akaQuick Emulator) does not properly skip MMIO regions, which allows localprivileged guest users to cause a denial of service (guest crash) viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8818` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu4').
